basics.name: Kai Garcia
basics.label: Software Engineer | Student
basics.summary: I am studying Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. At work I create and manage software for a publishing company, mainly using the LAMP development stack.

highlights: Upgraded and optimized legacy LAMP stack projects, implementing advanced features in payment tracking and overseeing systems handling $100K+ revenue, resulting in enhanced performance and scalability.
Streamlined engineering workflow, introduced local testing and Kanban task tracking, and optimized version control, achieving a 3x faster production cycle and error reduction.
Collaborated with non-tech management to clarify and implement feature requests, ensuring timely delivery and stakeholder satisfaction.
Recruited and mentored two developers, fostering a collaborative team environment through backlog grooming and pair programming practices.
Run workshops to teach entrepreneurs how to build prototypes for their ventures.
Manage inventory and budget for supplies and program costs.
10-week course in foundational AI concepts, machine learning, and ethics.
Collaborated to develop and train machine learning models using Python.
Explored real-world applications of AI, such as computer vision, natural language processing, and robotics.
